title: Keen 4 Mini-Mod Contest Results
content:
Over the past few months, Andy has been running a competition at Keen:Modding for Keen 4 mini-mods (a similar concept to the Keen:Vorticons one-level mod contest), in an attempt to get more people over the Keen 4 barrier.

Alas, there were only three entries, but they're some wonderful examples of where Keen 4-6 modding can take us. All three happen to exemplify a different element of modding. Xky demonstrates some intriguing patchwork, Levellass presents us with a promising atmospheric environment, and ZXD has successfully tackled sound effects and music.

Read about the competition and download the mods [url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewtopic.php?t=924]here[/url].

title: Re: Keen 4 Mini-Mod Contest Results
content:
Great to hear this, I shall download these immediately! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Congratulations on first place, Levelass! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] Well done, Xky and Zero Diamond! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

EDIT: Oh No, this is terrible! Xky's mod doesn't even want to start and Levelass's mod crashes as soon as I proceed to the main menu! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] The wizard mod crashed fairly soon too (when approaching one of those enemies, as stated in the forum post).____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: hehe
content:
I zipped up my entry as if it was an actual MOD-mod... just make a folder with a core copy of Keen4, and then unzip my entry into the folder--it will run fine from there.

Levellass's entry works the same way.

ZXD's game crashes because rather than spawning Slug poop, the Poison Slug (Necromancer) attempts to spawn a Wormouth... if you go to a level which has both Slugs and Wormouths in it by default, the Necromancers will work great. This is something that can be fixed with a little TED5 work--and I'm sure it will be resolved by the time the final release comes around.

Furthermore, ZXD has to get his Sound and Music Tutorial up and running--I know we're all eager to have a mod without "Kick in the Pants" playing. :P

title: Patch
content:
A simple sprite cache patch would fix that, it's what I made them for...

(And why do I keep getting logged out of this forum? It's tedious!)
